ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Ysheka
ygData.msgSnippet: Ooh, I ll have to check out the poachers there sometime. I have my tailoring at 167. I don t have much money and don t get to play as often as I d like. I want
ygData.messageBody:
Ooh, I'll have to check out the poachers there sometime.
I have my tailoring at 167. I don't have much money and don't get to play as
often as I'd like. I want to save my money up and am trying to figure out
the cheapest and easiest way to raise my tailoring to the 200s so I can do
my 6th shawl combine.
luv,
-Su


> You go from a ship in Stonebrunt, but instead of working on a timed
schedule
> like old world boats, you simply click the door and it zones you over. I
> thought it seemed like it ran pretty well on my 450 mhz, actually, and was
> one of the most "old world" zones out of any expansion since Luclin.
Jagged
> Pine is a bit rougher, think NK on crack, or a hyped version of DSP. The
> critters are aggressive and generally powerful. The humanoids in JP are
> somewhat easier, in fact my warrior soloed at the poachers at 51 and 52.
> Some of the various loots from the zone are nice, some weapons and
jewelry.
> The poachers drop pelts also, never lower than LQ, so for more advanced
> tailoring, this place is heaven.
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: mlockridge01 <MLockridge01@...>
> To: <EverQuest@yahoogroups.com>
> Sent: Thursday, September 18, 2003 3:34 AM
> Subject: [EverQuest] Ysheka
>
>
> > We bought the expansion for some of the features, rather than any
> > plans to go there. However, since we got the new computer, I have been
> > thinking of someday making the trip.
> >
> > Trouble is, I don't know how to get there. Granted, I haven't yet
> > tried, but when I look on some of the EQ sites I visit, I don't see
> > any way to get there. Is there a boat? From where? Is it even worth
> > going there?
> >
> > I haven't even gone to Jagged Pines since we got a machine that makes
> > the zone playable. In fact, I need to visit lots of places. I have
> > only limited experience on Luclin due to the lag. Been working Crystal
> > Caverns this last week, my first week on the new machine.
> >
> > Barto
